smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain visible elements and are not empty.

All use cases in the diagrams are associated with actors, either directly or via '<<include>>' relationships (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid' is included by user-triggered use cases).
No use cases were found with synonymous names associated with the same actor.
No distinct elements with the same name were found within the same package scope.
No redundant data copies were found in the database schemas; shared column names like 'nimetus' or 'on_aktiivne' are standard descriptors in unrelated tables or handle distinct data.
All use case names consistently start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' are reachable from the Start state.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' are reachable through the defined decision flows.

On the 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)' diagram (Page 12), the association between the 'Auto' class and the 'Auto_kütuse_liik' class lacks a multiplicity indicator (e.g., '0..*') on the 'Auto' end of the relationship line.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements (classes, use cases, etc.). The largest counts are around 7-9 elements.
No single element has 6 or more visual connection lines on any single diagram page. The most connected element ('Isik' on Page 6) has 5 connections.
The layout of the diagrams is uniform, with no related elements placed at excessive distances.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs.
The attribute 'vin' found in the 'Auto' class (visible on Page 11 and 12) consists of only 3 characters, which triggers the 'too short' rule.
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
All attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'mudel').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Tootaja').
No non-standard type prefixes (like 'tbl', 'str') were found in element names. Standard key prefixes (PK, FK) are allowed.
